japanese: まあ、あの大きな水槽を見ながら？
translation: Oh, while you were looking at that large aquarium?

japanese: うん、すごく良い雰囲気だったよ。
translation: Yeah, the atmosphere was really nice.

japanese:
よう。
なんの話をしてんだ？
translation:
Yo.
What were you talking about?

japanese:
ああ、フータロー君。
さっき君と行ったカフェの話。
translation:
Oh, Futaro-kun.
About the cafe we went to earlier.

japanese: カフェがあったなんて、気がつきませんでした。
translation: I didn't realize there was a cafe.

japanese:
水槽が目の前で、通りすぎる魚の鱗まで
しっかり見えちゃった。
translation:
We were sitting right in front of the tank.
We could clearly see the scales of the fish
swimming by.

japanese:
でも、居心地が良すぎてすっかり長居しちゃって、
他の場所はあんまり見れなかったんだよね。
translation:
But we were so comfortable that we ended up
staying there for a long time,
and didn't really see much of the other areas.

japanese:
それはもったいないですね……。
他にもたくさん見所がありましたよ？
translation:
That's a shame...
There were many other interesting things to see,
you know?

japanese:
へー。
五月ちゃんはどこが気に入ったの？
translation:
Really?
What did you like the most, Itsuki-chan?

japanese:
そうですね、
強いていうのならサンゴの水槽でしょうか。
とても綺麗でしたよ。
translation:
Well.
If I had to choose, maybe the coral tank.
It was really beautiful.

japanese:
住んでいる魚も、沖縄の生態系を再現していて、
本当に沖縄の海を覗き見ているようでした。
translation:
The fish living there rejuvenate
the Okinawan ecosystem. It really felt like
we were peeking into the Okinawan ocean.

japanese:
普段行く水族館では展示されていない魚も多く、
見ごたえもありましたし――
translation:
There were also many fish that aren't usually
displayed in the aquariums I usually go to,
so that was impressive%p-2;――

japanese:
海は繋がっていても、
場所によって景色が違う海中の生態系の多様さを
思い知りました。
translation:
Although the ocean is all connected, I realized that 
depending on the location, there's so much diversity 
in the underwater ecosystems and landscapes.

japanese: 五月ちゃん、めちゃくちゃ生き生き話してるね。
translation:
Itsuki-chan, you're really enthusiastic 
about all this stuff, aren't you?

japanese:
あ……。
すみません、つい。
translation:
Ah...
Sorry, I got carried away.

japanese:
ううん、もっと話してよ。
聞いてるだけで楽しいから。
translation:
No, please continue.
It's fun just listening to you.

japanese:
ああ、ただ見てるだけじゃなくて
学ぼうとしていたんだって伝わってくるぞ。
translation:
I can tell that you weren't just looking,
but were trying to learn something while doing so.

japanese:
そ、そんな。
たまたま係の人の説明を
聞くことができただけで……。
translation:
N-nothing like that.
I just happened to be able to hear
the explanation from the person in charge...

japanese:
私が水槽を見ていた時、
ちょうど餌やりの時間になって、
係員さんが色々と解説してくれたんですよ。
translation:
When I was looking at the tank,
it was just about feeding time,
and the staff explained a lot of things to us.

japanese: そういうサービスもあるのか。
translation: There's that kinda service?

japanese: そうそう、驚いたんですが――
translation: There is and I was surprised%p-2;――

japanese:
魚の中には、１週間に一度しか
餌を食べない種類もいるそうなんです！
１週間に一度だけですよ？
translation:
I learned some fish only eat once a week!
Can you believe it? Once a week!

japanese: え？　そんな驚くことか？
translation: Huh? Is it that surprising?

japanese:
驚きしかありません！
食事の楽しみが週にたった１回だなんて
考えられませんよ。
translation:
It's absolutely surprising!
I can't imagine only enjoying food once a week.

japanese: あはは、そういうことか。
translation: Ahaha, is that so?

japanese: 五月らしい……のか？
translation: That is totally an Itsuki thing to say...huh?

japanese:
わ、私だけじゃありません！
毎日の食事が楽しみなのは人類共通の想いでしょう？
translation:
I-it's not just me!
I think it's a common feeling among humans
to look forward to eating every day!

japanese: まあな、そういう考えもあるよな。
translation: Well, I suppose that's also true.

japanese:
え……。
まさか上杉君は週に一度でいいんですか！？
translation:
Ehh...
Wait, does that mean you'd be okay
with only eating once a week, Uesugi-kun?!

japanese:
いいというか、
それで生きていけるなら便利だとは思うぞ？
飯にかける時間を節約できる。
translation:
I wouldn't say I'd be okay with it,
but if I could survive on it, it'd be convenient, right? 
Saving time on having to cook food.

japanese: そ、そんな考えがあるなんて……！！
translation:
I-I can't believe
you actually think that way...!!

japanese:
いや、驚きすぎだろ。
そんなに変か？
translation:
Well, it's not that surprising. 
Is it really that strange?

japanese:
というか心配になってきたんだけど。
ダメだよ、ご飯はちゃんと食べないと。
倒れて病院送りとか嫌だからね？
translation:
I'm getting worried now. You can't skip meals.
You don't want to end up collapsing
and being sent to the hospital, do you?

japanese:
集中してるとな……。
２人はないのか？
集中してて食事が面倒になったりすること。
translation:
But if you're really focused on something... 
You two don't go through that? Sometimes it's a 
hassle to eat when you're really concentrating.

japanese:
絶対にありません。
そもそも空腹では集中できませんから。
translation:
Absolutely not.
I can't even concentrate if I'm
hungry in the first place.

japanese:
はあ～……。
そんな様子じゃ、フータロー君の
一人暮らしが心配だよ。
translation:
*sigh*
With that kind of attitude,
I'm worried about you living alone, Futaro-kun.

japanese:
いや、倒れるようなことはさすがにしない。
安心してくれ。
translation:
No, I wouldn't do anything as extreme as passing out.
Please don't worry.

japanese: 約束だよ？
translation: Promise?

japanese: ああ。
translation: Yeah.

japanese:
そういや、深海魚のコーナーもあるって
四葉が言ってたよな。
そっちは見たのか？
translation:
Come to think of it, Yotsuba said
there's also a deep-sea fish corner.
Did you see that?

japanese:
一応は見ましたが、時間がなくて
ざっと説明を読んだだけですね。
じっくり見たい気持ちはあったのですが。
translation:
I did see it in passing,
but I didn't have time to look closely.
I did want to take a closer look, though.

japanese:
わかってる。
人間の体は寝だめも食いだめもできないからな。
translation:
I know.
The human body can't go without food or sleep.

japanese: ほんとにわかってる？
translation: Do you really understand that?

japanese: ああ、お前らを見てたらな。
translation: Yeah, after watching how you guys live.

japanese:
あはは……。
言われちゃったなぁ。
translation:
Ahaha...
You're one to talk.

japanese: どういうことです？
translation: What do you mean?

japanese: いや、わからないならいい。
translation: Oh, it's nothing if you don't understand.

japanese:
むう……。
意味はわかりませんが、
失礼なことを言われた気がします。
translation:
Mmmhh...
I don't know what it means,
but I feel like I've been insulted.

japanese:
そういや、深海魚のコーナーもあるって
四葉が言ってたよな。
そっちは見たのか？
translation:
Come to think of it, Yotsuba said
there's also a deep-sea fish corner.
Did you see that?

japanese:
一応は見ましたが、時間がなくて
ざっと説明を読んだだけですね。
じっくり見たい気持ちはあったのですが。
translation:
I did see it in passing,
but I didn't have time to look closely.
I did want to take a closer look, though.

japanese: ああ、人間は体が資本だからな。
translation: One's body is their asset.

japanese: さっきと言ってることが違いませんか？
translation: Isn't that contradictory to what you said earlier?

japanese:
さっきのはもしもの話だ。
人間の体は魚とは違うんだからな。
translation:
That was just a hypothetical situation.
After all, the human body
is different from a fish's body.

japanese: それはそうだよね。
translation: That's true, isn't it.

japanese:
それと、人間は勉強だけ頑張ってもダメだと
嫌というほど思い知らされたからな。
translation:
And also, I've learned the hard way
that studying alone won't get you anywhere.

japanese: ふふっ、ここ１年で？
translation: Teehee, over this past year?

japanese:
あー……。
まあ、そうだな。
translation:
Yeeaah...
Well, I guess.

japanese:
とにかく、飯はちゃんと食う。
ぶっ倒れて心配かけないように。
translation:
Anyway, I'll make sure to eat properly.
So I won't pass out and worry anyone.

japanese:
それを聞けてお姉さんは安心しました。
ちゃんとしっかり三食食べるんだよ？
translation:
I'm relieved to hear that.
Make sure to eat three proper meals, okay?

japanese: お姉さんというより、お母さんの言葉では。
translation:
You sound like a mother
more than an older sister.

japanese:
そういや、深海魚のコーナーもあるって
四葉が言ってたよな。
そっちは見たのか？
translation:
Come to think of it, Yotsuba said
there's also a deep-sea fish corner.
Did you see that?

japanese:
一応は見ましたが、時間がなくて
ざっと説明を読んだだけですね。
じっくり見たい気持ちはあったのですが。
translation:
I did see it in passing,
but I didn't have time to look closely.
I did want to take a closer look, though.

japanese: もうちょっと時間を取ればよかったか？
translation: Should we have taken a bit more time?

japanese:
うーん、そうしちゃうと、
こうして海洋博公園を見学する時間が
なくなっちゃったよね。
translation:
Hmm, if we did that, we wouldn't have had time
to visit Ocean Expo Park like this.

japanese:
ホント、見所がありすぎて嬉しい悲鳴が出るよ。
旅行自体、もっと長くすればよかったかな。
translation:
Seriously, there are too many great places
to visit here.
Maybe we should have made the trip longer.

japanese:
いえ、この気持ちは
次に沖縄へ来る時までとっておきます。
translation:
No, I'll keep this feeling
for the next time I come to Okinawa.

japanese:
うん、また来よっか。
いつか、みんなで。
translation:
Yeah, let's come back again.
Someday, all together.
